data.title: 47 Facts About The Movie L.A. Confidential
data.meta_description: Dive into the dark underbelly of Los Angeles with these 47 shocking and fascinating facts about the critically acclaimed movie L.A. Confidential. Experience the corruption, secrets, and thrilling plot twists that make this neo-noir classic a must-watch.
data.text:
L.A. Confidential was released in 1997, directed by Curtis Hanson.

L.A. Confidential, a neo-noir crime film, was directed by Curtis Hanson and released in It is based on the novel of the same name by James Ellroy.

The movie stars Kevin Spacey, Russell Crowe, and Guy Pearce.

Kevin Spacey, Russell Crowe, and Guy Pearce deliver outstanding performances in their respective roles, adding depth to the movie.

The title refers to the city of Los Angeles and the idea of “confidential” information.

It takes place in the 1950s, during the post-World War II era.

The movie is set in the 1950s, capturing the essence of post-World War II Los Angeles, known for its glamour, corruption, and crime.

L.A. Confidential received critical acclaim, including nine Academy Award nominations.

The movie was highly praised by critics and received nine Academy Award nominations, including Best Picture, Best Director, and Best Adapted Screenplay.

The film won two Academy Awards for Best Supporting Actress and Best Adapted Screenplay.

Kim Basinger won the Best Supporting Actress award for her role in the film, while Curtis Hanson and Brian Helgeland won the award for Best Adapted Screenplay.

The story follows three LAPD officers as they investigate a murder case.

The plot revolves around three detectives, Bud White (Russell Crowe), Ed Exley (Guy Pearce), and Jack Vincennes (Kevin Spacey), as they delve into a complex murder investigation that leads them into corrupt alliances and dangerous territory.

Conclusion

In conclusion, L.A. Confidential is a masterpiece in the world of cinema. With its captivating storyline, brilliant performances, and meticulous attention to detail, this movie has earned its place as one of the greatest neo-noir films of all time. Its intricate plot twists and complex characters keep viewers on the edge of their seats, unraveling a web of corruption and deceit in 1950s Los Angeles.

The superb direction by Curtis Hanson, along with the outstanding ensemble cast including Kevin Spacey, Russell Crowe, and Guy Pearce, brings to life the dark and gritty atmosphere of the era. The film’s rich cinematography, atmospheric soundtrack, and gripping dialogue further contribute to its appeal, making it a must-watch for any fan of crime dramas.

Whether you are a movie buff or just looking for a thrilling cinematic experience, L.A. Confidential ticks all the boxes. It is a film that will engage, entertain, and leave you in awe of its brilliance long after the credits roll.
